But who was Gerty?: 1.7969253032990826
Gerty MacDowell who was seated near her companions, lost in thought, gazing far away into the distance was, in very truth, as fair a specimen of winsome Irish girlhood as one could wish to see.: 1.5479062674009376
She was pronounced beautiful by all who knew her though, as folks often said, she was more a Giltrap than a MacDowell.: 1.760784326820767
Her figure was slight and graceful, inclining even to fragility but those iron jelloids she had been taking of late had done her a world of good much better than the Widow Welch’s female pills and she was much better of those discharges she used to get and that tired feeling.: 1.8872373887814842
The waxen pallor of her face was almost spiritual in its ivorylike purity though her rosebud mouth was a genuine Cupid’s bow, Greekly perfect.: 2.203228647419983
Her hands were of finely veined alabaster with tapering fingers and as white as lemonjuice and queen of ointments could make them though it was not true that she used to wear kid gloves in bed or take a milk footbath either.: 1.8264582849027038
Bertha Supple told that once to Edy Boardman, a deliberate lie, when she was black out at daggers drawn with Gerty (the girl chums had of course their little tiffs from time to time like the rest of mortals) and she told her not to let on whatever she did that it was her that told her or she’d never speak to her again.: 1.9740096715495539
There was an innate refinement, a languid queenly _hauteur_ about Gerty which was unmistakably evidenced in her delicate hands and higharched instep.: 1.9362246360600266
Had kind fate but willed her to be born a gentlewoman of high degree in her own right and had she only received the benefit of a good education Gerty MacDowell might easily have held her own beside any lady in the land and have seen herself exquisitely gowned with jewels on her brow and patrician suitors at her feet vying with one another to pay their devoirs to her.: 1.7346734881336399
Mayhap it was this, the love that might have been, that lent to her softlyfeatured face at whiles a look, tense with suppressed meaning, that imparted a strange yearning tendency to the beautiful eyes, a charm few could resist.: 1.7767498819405056
Why have women such eyes of witchery?: 1.4668706183822715
Gerty’s were of the bluest Irish blue, set off by lustrous lashes and dark expressive brows.: 1.9946754297965619
Time was when those brows were not so silkily seductive.: 1.9244910730750058
It was Madame Vera Verity, directress of the Woman Beautiful page of the Princess Novelette, who had first advised her to try eyebrowleine which gave that haunting expression to the eyes, so becoming in leaders of fashion, and she had never regretted it.: 2.090864151590925
Then there was blushing scientifically cured and how to be tall increase your height and you have a beautiful face but your nose?: 1.770768542011739
That would suit Mrs Dignam because she had a button one.: 1.8025645169503424
But Gerty’s crowning glory was her wealth of wonderful hair.: 1.5867043596563175
It was dark brown with a natural wave in it.: 1.6186618027389146
She had cut it that very morning on account of the new moon and it nestled about her pretty head in a profusion of luxuriant clusters and pared her nails too, Thursday for wealth.: 2.2497502805665723
And just now at Edy’s words as a telltale flush, delicate as the faintest rosebloom, crept into her cheeks she looked so lovely in her sweet girlish shyness that of a surety God’s fair land of Ireland did not hold her equal.: 1.8262547773202995
For an instant she was silent with rather sad downcast eyes.: 1.7534648278867482
She was about to retort but something checked the words on her tongue.: 1.6960141180478328
The pretty lips pouted awhile but then she glanced up and broke out into a joyous little laugh which had in it all the freshness of a young May morning.: 2.1089788682011195
She knew right well, no-one better, what made squinty Edy say that because of him cooling in his attentions when it was simply a lovers’ quarrel.: 1.7612226121111818
As per usual somebody’s nose was out of joint about the boy that had the bicycle off the London bridge road always riding up and down in front of her window.: 2.0109726388200384
Only now his father kept him in in the evenings studying hard to get an exhibition in the intermediate that was on and he was going to go to Trinity college to study for a doctor when he left the high school like his brother W.: 1.936070110088626
E.: 1.7201479306608167
Wylie who was racing in the bicycle races in Trinity college university.: 1.4523606200833352
Little recked he perhaps for what she felt, that dull aching void in her heart sometimes, piercing to the core.: 1.5348537132795788
Yet he was young and perchance he might learn to love her in time.: 1.7292233017897105
They were protestants in his family and of course Gerty knew Who came first and after Him the Blessed Virgin and then Saint Joseph.: 1.7603169685809097
But he was undeniably handsome with an exquisite nose and he was what he looked, every inch a gentleman, the shape of his head too at the back without his cap on that she would know anywhere something off the common and the way he turned the bicycle at the lamp with his hands off the bars and also the nice perfume of those good cigarettes and besides they were both of a size too he and she and that was why Edy Boardman thought she was so frightfully clever because he didn’t go and ride up and down in front of her bit of a garden.: 2.1433336079131156
Gerty was dressed simply but with the instinctive taste of a votary of Dame Fashion for she felt that there was just a might that he might be out.: 2.661286782886273
A neat blouse of electric blue selftinted by dolly dyes (because it was expected in the _Lady’s Pictorial_ that electric blue would be worn) with a smart vee opening down to the division and kerchief pocket (in which she always kept a piece of cottonwool scented with her favourite perfume because the handkerchief spoiled the sit) and a navy threequarter skirt cut to the stride showed off her slim graceful figure to perfection.: 1.728819820078372
She wore a coquettish little love of a hat of wideleaved nigger straw contrast trimmed with an underbrim of eggblue chenille and at the side a butterfly bow of silk to tone.: 2.050562587516135
All Tuesday week afternoon she was hunting to match that chenille but at last she found what she wanted at Clery’s summer sales, the very it, slightly shopsoiled but you would never notice, seven fingers two and a penny.: 1.625330981807676
She did it up all by herself and what joy was hers when she tried it on then, smiling at the lovely reflection which the mirror gave back to her!: 1.6439812450106224
And when she put it on the waterjug to keep the shape she knew that that would take the shine out of some people she knew.: 2.7260148538100344
Her shoes were the newest thing in footwear (Edy Boardman prided herself that she was very _petite_ but she never had a foot like Gerty MacDowell, a five, and never would ash, oak or elm) with patent toecaps and just one smart buckle over her higharched instep.: 1.658488435480219
Her wellturned ankle displayed its perfect proportions beneath her skirt and just the proper amount and no more of her shapely limbs encased in finespun hose with highspliced heels and wide garter tops.: 1.6532287863692379
As for undies they were Gerty’s chief care and who that knows the fluttering hopes and fears of sweet seventeen (though Gerty would never see seventeen again) can find it in his heart to blame her?: 1.7218625379807673
She had four dinky sets with awfully pretty stitchery, three garments and nighties extra, and each set slotted with different coloured ribbons, rosepink, pale blue, mauve and peagreen, and she aired them herself and blued them when they came home from the wash and ironed them and she had a brickbat to keep the iron on because she wouldn’t trust those washerwomen as far as she’d see them scorching the things.: 2.1413049768080334

Universally that person’s acumen is esteemed very little perceptive concerning whatsoever matters are being held as most profitably by mortals with sapience endowed to be studied who is ignorant of that which the most in doctrine erudite and certainly by reason of that in them high mind’s ornament deserving of veneration constantly maintain when by general consent they affirm that other circumstances being equal by no exterior splendour is the prosperity of a nation more efficaciously asserted than by the measure of how far forward may have progressed the tribute of its solicitude for that proliferent continuance which of evils the original if it be absent when fortunately present constitutes the certain sign of omnipollent nature’s incorrupted benefaction.: 1.656155305860333
For who is there who anything of some significance has apprehended but is conscious that that exterior splendour may be the surface of a downwardtending lutulent reality or on the contrary anyone so is there unilluminated as not to perceive that as no nature’s boon can contend against the bounty of increase so it behoves every most just citizen to become the exhortator and admonisher of his semblables and to tremble lest what had in the past been by the nation excellently commenced might be in the future not with similar excellence accomplished if an inverecund habit shall have gradually traduced the honourable by ancestors transmitted customs to that thither of profundity that that one was audacious excessively who would have the hardihood to rise affirming that no more odious offence can for anyone be than to oblivious neglect to consign that evangel simultaneously command and promise which on all mortals with prophecy of abundance or with diminution’s menace that exalted of reiteratedly procreating function ever irrevocably enjoined?: 1.8165276726868635
It is not why therefore we shall wonder if, as the best historians relate, among the Celts, who nothing that was not in its nature admirable admired, the art of medicine shall have been highly honoured.: 2.3079936835510315
Not to speak of hostels, leperyards, sweating chambers, plaguegraves, their greatest doctors, the O’Shiels, the O’Hickeys, the O’Lees, have sedulously set down the divers methods by which the sick and the relapsed found again health whether the malady had been the trembling withering or loose boyconnell flux.: 2.5521932602027335
Certainly in every public work which in it anything of gravity contains preparation should be with importance commensurate and therefore a plan was by them adopted (whether by having preconsidered or as the maturation of experience it is difficult in being said which the discrepant opinions of subsequent inquirers are not up to the present congrued to render manifest) whereby maternity was so far from all accident possibility removed that whatever care the patient in that allhardest of woman hour chiefly required and not solely for the copiously opulent but also for her who not being sufficiently moneyed scarcely and often not even scarcely could subsist valiantly and for an inconsiderable emolument was provided.: 1.71339538398397
To her nothing already then and thenceforward was anyway able to be molestful for this chiefly felt all citizens except with proliferent mothers prosperity at all not to can be and as they had received eternity gods mortals generation to befit them her beholding, when the case was so hoving itself, parturient in vehicle thereward carrying desire immense among all one another was impelling on of her to be received into that domicile.: 1.978300531593484
O thing of prudent nation not merely in being seen but also even in being related worthy of being praised that they her by anticipation went seeing mother, that she by them suddenly to be about to be cherished had been begun she felt!: 1.5995737092135245
Before born bliss babe had.: 1.2447100303782723

A couch by midwives attended with wholesome food reposeful, cleanest swaddles as though forthbringing were now done and by wise foresight set: but to this no less of what drugs there is need and surgical implements which are pertaining to her case not omitting aspect of all very distracting spectacles in various latitudes by our terrestrial orb offered together with images, divine and human, the cogitation of which by sejunct females is to tumescence conducive or eases issue in the high sunbright wellbuilt fair home of mothers when, ostensibly far gone and reproductitive, it is come by her thereto to lie in, her term up.: 1.8210059293366145
Some man that wayfaring was stood by housedoor at night’s oncoming.: 2.062343052992995
Of Israel’s folk was that man that on earth wandering far had fared.: 1.5547859098437298

Of that house A.: 1.6105760817076815
Seventy beds keeps he there teeming mothers are wont that they lie for to thole and bring forth bairns hale so God’s angel to Mary quoth.: 1.7115920542114975
Watchers tway there walk, white sisters in ward sleepless.: 1.740938627236402
Smarts they still, sickness soothing: in twelve moons thrice an hundred.: 1.3656112510792011
Truest bedthanes they twain are, for Horne holding wariest ward.: 1.4179115013907788
In ward wary the watcher hearing come that man mildhearted eft rising with swire ywimpled to him her gate wide undid.: 1.9401942860748238
Lo, levin leaping lightens in eyeblink Ireland’s westward welkin.: 2.315422255846208

Christ’s rood made she on breastbone and him drew that he would rathe infare under her thatch.: 1.9457556265345617
That man her will wotting worthful went in Horne’s house.: 1.7314603706211513
Loth to irk in Horne’s hall hat holding the seeker stood.: 1.9882684601604514
On her stow he ere was living with dear wife and lovesome daughter that then over land and seafloor nine years had long outwandered.: 1.4534712668359477
Once her in townhithe meeting he to her bow had not doffed.: 1.8126349257506194
Her to forgive now he craved with good ground of her allowed that that of him swiftseen face, hers, so young then had looked.: 1.7045710760217476
Light swift her eyes kindled, bloom of blushes his word winning.: 1.4474626900984584

Glad after she was that ere adread was.: 1.8090934434663057

Sad was the man that word to hear that him so heavied in bowels ruthful.: 2.3494112200658046
All she there told him, ruing death for friend so young, algate sore unwilling God’s rightwiseness to withsay.: 1.887827373056501

He heard her sad words, in held hat sad staring.: 1.49812906357042

The man that was come in to the house then spoke to the nursingwoman and he asked her how it fared with the woman that lay there in childbed.: 1.8607382840992914
The nursingwoman answered him and said that that woman was in throes now full three days and that it would be a hard birth unneth to bear but that now in a little it would be.: 1.9391843356245555
She said thereto that she had seen many births of women but never was none so hard as was that woman’s birth.: 1.8278967108771418
Then she set it all forth to him for because she knew the man that time was had lived nigh that house.: 2.014175341117017
The man hearkened to her words for he felt with wonder women’s woe in the travail that they have of motherhood and he wondered to look on her face that was a fair face for any man to see but yet was she left after long years a handmaid.: 2.18861365368989
Nine twelve bloodflows chiding her childless.: 1.4261698784269696
And whiles they spake the door of the castle was opened and there nighed them a mickle noise as of many that sat there at meat.: 1.942834516351543
And there came against the place as they stood a young learningknight yclept Dixon.: 1.5829030010402967
And the traveller Leopold was couth to him sithen it had happed that they had had ado each with other in the house of misericord where this learningknight lay by cause the traveller Leopold came there to be healed for he was sore wounded in his breast by a spear wherewith a horrible and dreadful dragon was smitten him for which he did do make a salve of volatile salt and chrism as much as he might suffice.: 2.0662895641718135
And he said now that he should go in to that castle for to make merry with them that were there.: 2.0444017353001107
And the traveller Leopold said that he should go otherwhither for he was a man of cautels and a subtile.: 3.345773317931248
Also the lady was of his avis and repreved the learningknight though she trowed well that the traveller had said thing that was false for his subtility.: 2.2570728982712653
But the learningknight would not hear say nay nor do her mandement ne have him in aught contrarious to his list and he said how it was a marvellous castle.: 1.9787636097354087
And the traveller Leopold went into the castle for to rest him for a space being sore of limb after many marches environing in divers lands and sometime venery.: 1.705459932737732
And in the castle was set a board that was of the birchwood of Finlandy and it was upheld by four dwarfmen of that country but they durst not move more for enchantment.: 2.9276960855899024
And on this board were frightful swords and knives that are made in a great cavern by swinking demons out of white flames that they fix then in the horns of buffalos and stags that there abound marvellously.: 2.157584846769132
And there were vessels that are wrought by magic of Mahound out of seasand and the air by a warlock with his breath that he blases in to them like to bubbles.: 2.970676931644503
And full fair cheer and rich was on the board that no wight could devise a fuller ne richer.: 1.5651867815926326
And there was a vat of silver that was moved by craft to open in the which lay strange fishes withouten heads though misbelieving men nie that this be possible thing without they see it natheless they are so.: 1.7352925991967516
And these fishes lie in an oily water brought there from Portugal land because of the fatness that therein is like to the juices of the olivepress.: 2.1491396062247983
And also it was a marvel to see in that castle how by magic they make a compost out of fecund wheatkidneys out of Chaldee that by aid of certain angry spirits that they do in to it swells up wondrously like to a vast mountain.: 2.3181952406325714
And they teach the serpents there to entwine themselves up on long sticks out of the ground and of the scales of these serpents they brew out a brewage like to mead.: 2.125605065332454
And the learning knight let pour for childe Leopold a draught and halp thereto the while all they that were there drank every each.: 1.4659695686199177
And childe Leopold did up his beaver for to pleasure him and took apertly somewhat in amity for he never drank no manner of mead which he then put by and anon full privily he voided the more part in his neighbour glass and his neighbour nist not of this wile.: 1.705160722394612
And he sat down in that castle with them for to rest him there awhile.: 2.1596653955797604
Thanked be Almighty God.: 1.2407068409934616

Meseems it dureth overlong.: 2.415995489432173

But, said he, or it be long too she will bring forth by God His bounty and have joy of her childing for she hath waited marvellous long.: 1.8183687032001759
And the franklin that had drunken said, Expecting each moment to be her next.: 1.521998956853533

And sir Leopold that was the goodliest guest that ever sat in scholars’ hall and that was the meekest man and the kindest that ever laid husbandly hand under hen and that was the very truest knight of the world one that ever did minion service to lady gentle pledged him courtly in the cup.: 2.3954764992920867
Woman’s woe with wonder pondering.: 2.862283788081546
Now let us speak of that fellowship that was there to the intent to be drunken an they might.: 2.0617575918046294
There was a sort of scholars along either side the board, that is to wit, Dixon yclept junior of saint Mary Merciable’s with other his fellows Lynch and Madden, scholars of medicine, and the franklin that hight Lenehan and one from Alba Longa, one Crotthers, and young Stephen that had mien of a frere that was at head of the board and Costello that men clepen Punch Costello all long of a mastery of him erewhile gested (and of all them, reserved young Stephen, he was the most drunken that demanded still of more mead) and beside the meek sir Leopold.: 2.056929333980786
But on young Malachi they waited for that he promised to have come and such as intended to no goodness said how he had broke his avow.: 1.625192993528418
And sir Leopold sat with them for he bore fast friendship to sir Simon and to this his son young Stephen and for that his languor becalmed him there after longest wanderings insomuch as they feasted him for that time in the honourablest manner.: 2.079043962841507
Ruth red him, love led on with will to wander, loth to leave.: 1.5064371150440494
For they were right witty scholars.: 1.3819994761789043
And he heard their aresouns each gen other as touching birth and righteousness, young Madden maintaining that put such case it were hard the wife to die (for so it had fallen out a matter of some year agone with a woman of Eblana in Horne’s house that now was trespassed out of this world and the self night next before her death all leeches and pothecaries had taken counsel of her case).: 1.9734032238486172
And they said farther she should live because in the beginning, they said, the woman should bring forth in pain and wherefore they that were of this imagination affirmed how young Madden had said truth for he had conscience to let her die.: 1.7571372111395982
And not few and of these was young Lynch were in doubt that the world was now right evil governed as it was never other howbeit the mean people believed it otherwise but the law nor his judges did provide no remedy.: 1.5494944791549514
A redress God grant.: 2.0961004639311134
This was scant said but all cried with one acclaim nay, by our Virgin Mother, the wife should live and the babe to die.: 1.5978332333067558

Then spake young Stephen orgulous of mother Church that would cast him out of her bosom, of law of canons, of Lilith, patron of abortions, of bigness wrought by wind of seeds of brightness or by potency of vampires mouth to mouth or, as Virgilius saith, by the influence of the occident or by the reek of moonflower or an she lie with a woman which her man has but lain with, _effectu secuto_, or peradventure in her bath according to the opinions of Averroes and Moses Maimonides.: 2.3946355636050334
He said also how at the end of the second month a human soul was infused and how in all our holy mother foldeth ever souls for God’s greater glory whereas that earthly mother which was but a dam to bear beastly should die by canon for so saith he that holdeth the fisherman’s seal, even that blessed Peter on which rock was holy church for all ages founded.: 1.932342060905384
All they bachelors then asked of sir Leopold would he in like case so jeopard her person as risk life to save life.: 1.5102527424388075
A wariness of mind he would answer as fitted all and, laying hand to jaw, he said dissembling, as his wont was, that as it was informed him, who had ever loved the art of physic as might a layman, and agreeing also with his experience of so seldomseen an accident it was good for that mother Church belike at one blow had birth and death pence and in such sort deliverly he scaped their questions.: 1.975783403824143
That is truth, pardy, said Dixon, and, or I err, a pregnant word.: 2.4239453414189542

But sir Leopold was passing grave maugre his word by cause he still had pity of the terrorcausing shrieking of shrill women in their labour and as he was minded of his good lady Marion that had borne him an only manchild which on his eleventh day on live had died and no man of art could save so dark is destiny.: 1.7348422314755652
And she was wondrous stricken of heart for that evil hap and for his burial did him on a fair corselet of lamb’s wool, the flower of the flock, lest he might perish utterly and lie akeled (for it was then about the midst of the winter) and now sir Leopold that had of his body no manchild for an heir looked upon him his friend’s son and was shut up in sorrow for his forepassed happiness and as sad as he was that him failed a son of such gentle courage (for all accounted him of real parts) so grieved he also in no less measure for young Stephen for that he lived riotously with those wastrels and murdered his goods with whores.: 1.8190421445492968

It was an ancient and a sad matron of a sedate look and christian walking, in habit dun beseeming her megrims and wrinkled visage, nor did her hortative want of it effect for incontinently Punch Costello was of them all embraided and they reclaimed the churl with civil rudeness some and shaked him with menace of blandishments others whiles they all chode with him, a murrain seize the dolt, what a devil he would be at, thou chuff, thou puny, thou got in peasestraw, thou losel, thou chitterling, thou spawn of a rebel, thou dykedropt, thou abortion thou, to shut up his drunken drool out of that like a curse of God ape, the good sir Leopold that had for his cognisance the flower of quiet, margerain gentle, advising also the time’s occasion as most sacred and most worthy to be most sacred.: 2.152967679016789

First, saved from waters of old Nile, among bulrushes, a bed of fasciated wattles: at last the cavity of a mountain, an occulted sepulchre amid the conclamation of the hillcat and the ossifrage.: 2.1032688604381526
And as no man knows the ubicity of his tumulus nor to what processes we shall thereby be ushered nor whether to Tophet or to Edenville in the like way is all hidden when we would backward see from what region of remoteness the whatness of our whoness hath fetched his whenceness.: 1.829457165206251
Thereto Punch Costello roared out mainly _Etienne chanson_ but he loudly bid them, lo, wisdom hath built herself a house, this vast majestic longstablished vault, the crystal palace of the Creator, all in applepie order, a penny for him who finds the pea.: 2.0287544911872835
Behold the mansion reared by dedal Jack      See the malt stored in many a refluent sack,      In the proud cirque of Jackjohn’s bivouac.: 2.0913078941562966
A black crack of noise in the street here, alack, bawled back.: 2.4048303049692925
Loud on left Thor thundered: in anger awful the hammerhurler.: 1.4726256200719834
Came now the storm that hist his heart.: 1.4319353543091278
And Master Lynch bade him have a care to flout and witwanton as the god self was angered for his hellprate and paganry.: 2.9492345424244224
And he that had erst challenged to be so doughty waxed wan as they might all mark and shrank together and his pitch that was before so haught uplift was now of a sudden quite plucked down and his heart shook within the cage of his breast as he tasted the rumour of that storm.: 1.9167272335689018
Then did some mock and some jeer and Punch Costello fell hard again to his yale which Master Lenehan vowed he would do after and he was indeed but a word and a blow on any the least colour.: 1.71269139144637
But the braggart boaster cried that an old Nobodaddy was in his cups it was muchwhat indifferent and he would not lag behind his lead.: 1.8871467176492698
But this was only to dye his desperation as cowed he crouched in Horne’s hall.: 2.3460633362968504
He drank indeed at one draught to pluck up a heart of any grace for it thundered long rumblingly over all the heavens so that Master Madden, being godly certain whiles, knocked him on his ribs upon that crack of doom and Master Bloom, at the braggart’s side, spoke to him calming words to slumber his great fear, advertising how it was no other thing but a hubbub noise that he heard, the discharge of fluid from the thunderhead, look you, having taken place, and all of the order of a natural phenomenon.: 1.8319926821108348
But was young Boasthard’s fear vanquished by Calmer’s words?: 1.7314382262272259
No, for he had in his bosom a spike named Bitterness which could not by words be done away.: 1.8722877093488715
And was he then neither calm like the one nor godly like the other?: 1.7703502780119182
He was neither as much as he would have liked to be either.: 2.2066166159484415
But could he not have endeavoured to have found again as in his youth the bottle Holiness that then he lived withal?: 1.635638771550981
Indeed no for Grace was not there to find that bottle.: 1.591349323536225
Heard he then in that clap the voice of the god Bringforth or, what Calmer said, a hubbub of Phenomenon?: 1.9482891726365807
Heard?: 6.7868607478111596
Why, he could not but hear unless he had plugged him up the tube Understanding (which he had not done).: 2.19236529492832
For through that tube he saw that he was in the land of Phenomenon where he must for a certain one day die as he was like the rest too a passing show.: 2.503921021453224
And would he not accept to die like the rest and pass away?: 1.9295635669417057
By no means would he though he must nor would he make more shows according as men do with wives which Phenomenon has commanded them to do by the book Law.: 1.5713565648023609
Then wotted he nought of that other land which is called Believe-on-Me, that is the land of promise which behoves to the king Delightful and shall be for ever where there is no death and no birth neither wiving nor mothering at which all shall come as many as believe on it?: 1.79868481811507
Yes, Pious had told him of that land and Chaste had pointed him to the way but the reason was that in the way he fell in with a certain whore of an eyepleasing exterior whose name, she said, is Bird-in-the-Hand and she beguiled him wrongways from the true path by her flatteries that she said to him as, Ho, you pretty man, turn aside hither and I will show you a brave place, and she lay at him so flatteringly that she had him in her grot which is named Two-in-the-Bush or, by some learned, Carnal Concupiscence.: 2.183372531146006
This was it what all that company that sat there at commons in Manse of Mothers the most lusted after and if they met with this whore Bird-in-the-Hand (which was within all foul plagues, monsters and a wicked devil) they would strain the last but they would make at her and know her.: 1.737721425333095
For regarding Believe-on-Me they said it was nought else but notion and they could conceive no thought of it for, first, Two-in-the-Bush whither she ticed them was the very goodliest grot and in it were four pillows on which were four tickets with these words printed on them, Pickaback and Topsyturvy and Shameface and Cheek by Jowl and, second, for that foul plague Allpox and the monsters they cared not for them for Preservative had given them a stout shield of oxengut and, third, that they might take no hurt neither from Offspring that was that wicked devil by virtue of this same shield which was named Killchild.: 1.9004784082561432
So were they all in their blind fancy, Mr Cavil and Mr Sometimes Godly, Mr Ape Swillale, Mr False Franklin, Mr Dainty Dixon, Young Boasthard and Mr Cautious Calmer.: 1.7918689467866793
Wherein, O wretched company, were ye all deceived for that was the voice of the god that was in a very grievous rage that he would presently lift his arm up and spill their souls for their abuses and their spillings done by them contrariwise to his word which forth to bring brenningly biddeth.: 2.3269066348947574
So Thursday sixteenth June Patk.: 1.2135196549956038
Dignam laid in clay of an apoplexy and after hard drought, please God, rained, a bargeman coming in by water a fifty mile or thereabout with turf saying the seed won’t sprout, fields athirst, very sadcoloured and stunk mightily, the quags and tofts too.: 2.3225994553473908
Hard to breathe and all the young quicks clean consumed without sprinkle this long while back as no man remembered to be without.: 1.942197599808026
The rosy buds all gone brown and spread out blobs and on the hills nought but dry flag and faggots that would catch at first fire.: 1.509014714576969
All the world saying, for aught they knew, the big wind of last February a year that did havoc the land so pitifully a small thing beside this barrenness.: 1.7371423761974072
In Ely place, Baggot street, Duke’s lawn, thence through Merrion green up to Holles street a swash of water flowing that was before bonedry and not one chair or coach or fiacre seen about but no more crack after that first.: 1.7649477722725067
Over against the Rt.: 1.6756024455970493
Hon.: 5.467216183749365
Mulligan a gentleman’s gentleman that had but come from Mr Moore’s the writer’s (that was a papish but is now, folk say, a good Williamite) chanced against Alec.: 2.268320665880082
Bannon in a cut bob (which are now in with dance cloaks of Kendal green) that was new got to town from Mullingar with the stage where his coz and Mal M’s brother will stay a month yet till Saint Swithin and asks what in the earth he does there, he bound home and he to Andrew Horne’s being stayed for to crush a cup of wine, so he said, but would tell him of a skittish heifer, big of her age and beef to the heel, and all this while poured with rain and so both together on to Horne’s.: 1.84030296981909
There Leop.: 1.2025720567418605
Bloom of Crawford’s journal sitting snug with a covey of wags, likely brangling fellows, Dixon jun., scholar of my lady of Mercy’s, Vin.: 1.7303614968227115
Lynch, a Scots fellow, Will.: 1.557917408502538
Madden, T.: 1.2811976983934366
Lenehan, very sad about a racer he fancied and Stephen D.: 1.9885610937874787
Leop.: 1.5080636023718699
Bloom there for a languor he had but was now better, he having dreamed tonight a strange fancy of his dame Mrs Moll with red slippers on in a pair of Turkey trunks which is thought by those in ken to be for a change and Mistress Purefoy there, that got in through pleading her belly, and now on the stools, poor body, two days past her term, the midwives sore put to it and can’t deliver, she queasy for a bowl of riceslop that is a shrewd drier up of the insides and her breath very heavy more than good and should be a bullyboy from the knocks, they say, but God give her soon issue.: 1.9037745515566296
’Tis her ninth chick to live, I hear, and Lady day bit off her last chick’s nails that was then a twelvemonth and with other three all breastfed that died written out in a fair hand in the king’s bible.: 1.9660550967247477
Her hub fifty odd and a methodist but takes the sacrament and is to be seen any fair sabbath with a pair of his boys off Bullock harbour dapping on the sound with a heavybraked reel or in a punt he has trailing for flounder and pollock and catches a fine bag, I hear.: 1.7901713338140541
In sum an infinite great fall of rain and all refreshed and will much increase the harvest yet those in ken say after wind and water fire shall come for a prognostication of Malachi’s almanac (and I hear that Mr Russell has done a prophetical charm of the same gist out of the Hindustanish for his farmer’s gazette) to have three things in all but this a mere fetch without bottom of reason for old crones and bairns yet sometimes they are found in the right guess with their queerities no telling how.: 1.9315406643828945
With this came up Lenehan to the feet of the table to say how the letter was in that night’s gazette and he made a show to find it about him (for he swore with an oath that he had been at pains about it) but on Stephen’s persuasion he gave over the search and was bidden to sit near by which he did mighty brisk.: 2.0436238622629537
He was a kind of sport gentleman that went for a merryandrew or honest pickle and what belonged of women, horseflesh or hot scandal he had it pat.: 2.1440365838860207
To tell the truth he was mean in fortunes and for the most part hankered about the coffeehouses and low taverns with crimps, ostlers, bookies, Paul’s men, runners, flatcaps, waistcoateers, ladies of the bagnio and other rogues of the game or with a chanceable catchpole or a tipstaff often at nights till broad day of whom he picked up between his sackpossets much loose gossip.: 2.391087966882474
He took his ordinary at a boilingcook’s and if he had but gotten into him a mess of broken victuals or a platter of tripes with a bare tester in his purse he could always bring himself off with his tongue, some randy quip he had from a punk or whatnot that every mother’s son of them would burst their sides.: 2.3673276852932776
The other, Costello that is, hearing this talk asked was it poetry or a tale.: 1.857428938151707
Faith, no, he says, Frank (that was his name), ’tis all about Kerry cows that are to be butchered along of the plague.: 2.1694436188418
But they can go hang, says he with a wink, for me with their bully beef, a pox on it.: 1.963050429775145
There’s as good fish in this tin as ever came out of it and very friendly he offered to take of some salty sprats that stood by which he had eyed wishly in the meantime and found the place which was indeed the chief design of his embassy as he was sharpset.: 2.4153534223508712
_Mort aux vaches_, says Frank then in the French language that had been indentured to a brandyshipper that has a winelodge in Bordeaux and he spoke French like a gentleman too.: 3.5039217731797874
From a child this Frank had been a donought that his father, a headborough, who could ill keep him to school to learn his letters and the use of the globes, matriculated at the university to study the mechanics but he took the bit between his teeth like a raw colt and was more familiar with the justiciary and the parish beadle than with his volumes.: 2.1555079292729085
One time he would be a playactor, then a sutler or a welsher, then nought would keep him from the bearpit and the cocking main, then he was for the ocean sea or to hoof it on the roads with the romany folk, kidnapping a squire’s heir by favour of moonlight or fecking maids’ linen or choking chicken behind a hedge.: 2.2663284066465597
He had been off as many times as a cat has lives and back again with naked pockets as many more to his father the headborough who shed a pint of tears as often as he saw him.: 1.7408951062881883
What, says Mr Leopold with his hands across, that was earnest to know the drift of it, will they slaughter all?: 2.1641381249831415
I protest I saw them but this day morning going to the Liverpool boats, says he.: 1.7843812973774948
I can scarce believe ’tis so bad, says he.: 1.6440839512269736
And he had experience of the like brood beasts and of springers, greasy hoggets and wether wool, having been some years before actuary for Mr Joseph Cuffe, a worthy salesmaster that drove his trade for live stock and meadow auctions hard by Mr Gavin Low’s yard in Prussia street.: 1.7350079788827883
I question with you there, says he.: 1.9738048772276842
More like ’tis the hoose or the timber tongue.: 1.4755442668018766
Mr Stephen, a little moved but very handsomely told him no such matter and that he had dispatches from the emperor’s chief tailtickler thanking him for the hospitality, that was sending over Doctor Rinderpest, the bestquoted cowcatcher in all Muscovy, with a bolus or two of physic to take the bull by the horns.: 2.634032118335134
Come, come, says Mr Vincent, plain dealing.: 2.0373795959462035
He’ll find himself on the horns of a dilemma if he meddles with a bull that’s Irish, says he.: 2.8835396716532893
Irish by name and irish by nature, says Mr Stephen, and he sent the ale purling about, an Irish bull in an English chinashop.: 1.882515547377296
I conceive you, says Mr Dixon.: 3.0923602226236047
It is that same bull that was sent to our island by farmer Nicholas, the bravest cattlebreeder of them all, with an emerald ring in his nose.: 1.9307010387980104
True for you, says Mr Vincent cross the table, and a bullseye into the bargain, says he, and a plumper and a portlier bull, says he, never shit on shamrock.: 3.0611722720279615
He had horns galore, a coat of cloth of gold and a sweet smoky breath coming out of his nostrils so that the women of our island, leaving doughballs and rollingpins, followed after him hanging his bulliness in daisychains.: 2.289276245330018
What for that, says Mr Dixon, but before he came over farmer Nicholas that was a eunuch had him properly gelded by a college of doctors who were no better off than himself.: 1.8360118826406266
So be off now, says he, and do all my cousin german the lord Harry tells you and take a farmer’s blessing, and with that he slapped his posteriors very soundly.: 2.0183533218202157
But the slap and the blessing stood him friend, says Mr Vincent, for to make up he taught him a trick worth two of the other so that maid, wife, abbess and widow to this day affirm that they would rather any time of the month whisper in his ear in the dark of a cowhouse or get a lick on the nape from his long holy tongue than lie with the finest strapping young ravisher in the four fields of all Ireland.: 2.0272464595472983
Another then put in his word: And they dressed him, says he, in a point shift and petticoat with a tippet and girdle and ruffles on his wrists and clipped his forelock and rubbed him all over with spermacetic oil and built stables for him at every turn of the road with a gold manger in each full of the best hay in the market so that he could doss and dung to his heart’s content.: 2.169515768273889
By this time the father of the faithful (for so they called him) was grown so heavy that he could scarce walk to pasture.: 1.8590939293126112
Ay, says another, and so pampered was he that he would suffer nought to grow in all the land but green grass for himself (for that was the only colour to his mind) and there was a board put up on a hillock in the middle of the island with a printed notice, saying: By the Lord Harry, Green is the grass that grows on the ground.: 2.0866464492754195
And, says Mr Dixon, if ever he got scent of a cattleraider in Roscommon or the wilds of Connemara or a husbandman in Sligo that was sowing as much as a handful of mustard or a bag of rapeseed out he’d run amok over half the countryside rooting up with his horns whatever was planted and all by lord Harry’s orders.: 2.2591446876120336
There was bad blood between them at first, says Mr Vincent, and the lord Harry called farmer Nicholas all the old Nicks in the world and an old whoremaster that kept seven trulls in his house and I’ll meddle in his matters, says he.: 2.766078809556795
I’ll make that animal smell hell, says he, with the help of that good pizzle my father left me.: 2.646215754179388
But one evening, says Mr Dixon, when the lord Harry was cleaning his royal pelt to go to dinner after winning a boatrace (he had spade oars for himself but the first rule of the course was that the others were to row with pitchforks) he discovered in himself a wonderful likeness to a bull and on picking up a blackthumbed chapbook that he kept in the pantry he found sure enough that he was a lefthanded descendant of the famous champion bull of the Romans, _Bos Bovum_, which is good bog Latin for boss of the show.: 2.116193590243968
After that, says Mr Vincent, the lord Harry put his head into a cow’s drinkingtrough in the presence of all his courtiers and pulling it out again told them all his new name.: 2.468202605900411
Then, with the water running off him, he got into an old smock and skirt that had belonged to his grandmother and bought a grammar of the bulls’ language to study but he could never learn a word of it except the first personal pronoun which he copied out big and got off by heart and if ever he went out for a walk he filled his pockets with chalk to write it upon what took his fancy, the side of a rock or a teahouse table or a bale of cotton or a corkfloat.: 2.088577862935205
In short, he and the bull of Ireland were soon as fast friends as an arse and a shirt.: 1.6335068241211803
They were, says Mr Stephen, and the end was that the men of the island seeing no help was toward, as the ungrate women were all of one mind, made a wherry raft, loaded themselves and their bundles of chattels on shipboard, set all masts erect, manned the yards, sprang their luff, heaved to, spread three sheets in the wind, put her head between wind and water, weighed anchor, ported her helm, ran up the jolly Roger, gave three times three, let the bullgine run, pushed off in their bumboat and put to sea to recover the main of America.: 2.1715220663179293
Which was the occasion, says Mr Vincent, of the composing by a boatswain of that rollicking chanty:  _—Pope Peter’s but a pissabed.: 2.5485670512455565
A man’s a man for a’ that._  Our worthy acquaintance Mr Malachi Mulligan now appeared in the doorway as the students were finishing their apologue accompanied with a friend whom he had just rencountered, a young gentleman, his name Alec Bannon, who had late come to town, it being his intention to buy a colour or a cornetcy in the fencibles and list for the wars.: 2.2844333588186716
Mr Mulligan was civil enough to express some relish of it all the more as it jumped with a project of his own for the cure of the very evil that had been touched on.: 1.847550930772621
Whereat he handed round to the company a set of pasteboard cards which he had had printed that day at Mr Quinnell’s bearing a legend printed in fair italics: _Mr Malachi Mulligan.: 1.8807897649482739
Fertiliser and Incubator.: 9.154444478594739
Lambay Island_.: 1.6907479287571148
His project, as he went on to expound, was to withdraw from the round of idle pleasures such as form the chief business of sir Fopling Popinjay and sir Milksop Quidnunc in town and to devote himself to the noblest task for which our bodily organism has been framed.: 2.372125920027711
Well, let us hear of it, good my friend, said Mr Dixon.: 2.686305658596135
I make no doubt it smacks of wenching.: 2.1713876833615666
Come, be seated, both.: 2.9847019062692484
’Tis as cheap sitting as standing.: 1.3553711741339656
Mr Mulligan accepted of the invitation and, expatiating upon his design, told his hearers that he had been led into this thought by a consideration of the causes of sterility, both the inhibitory and the prohibitory, whether the inhibition in its turn were due to conjugal vexations or to a parsimony of the balance as well as whether the prohibition proceeded from defects congenital or from proclivities acquired.: 2.0570507799928817
It grieved him plaguily, he said, to see the nuptial couch defrauded of its dearest pledges: and to reflect upon so many agreeable females with rich jointures, a prey to the vilest bonzes, who hide their flambeau under a bushel in an uncongenial cloister or lose their womanly bloom in the embraces of some unaccountable muskin when they might multiply the inlets of happiness, sacrificing the inestimable jewel of their sex when a hundred pretty fellows were at hand to caress, this, he assured them, made his heart weep.: 2.5487161877523286
To curb this inconvenient (which he concluded due to a suppression of latent heat), having advised with certain counsellors of worth and inspected into this matter, he had resolved to purchase in fee simple for ever the freehold of Lambay island from its holder, lord Talbot de Malahide, a Tory gentleman of note much in favour with our ascendancy party.: 1.7449065446209648
He proposed to set up there a national fertilising farm to be named _Omphalos_ with an obelisk hewn and erected after the fashion of Egypt and to offer his dutiful yeoman services for the fecundation of any female of what grade of life soever who should there direct to him with the desire of fulfilling the functions of her natural.: 1.6756679561229815
Money was no object, he said, nor would he take a penny for his pains.: 2.369421055182193
The poorest kitchenwench no less than the opulent lady of fashion, if so be their constructions and their tempers were warm persuaders for their petitions, would find in him their man.: 2.4989653907792024
For his nutriment he shewed how he would feed himself exclusively upon a diet of savoury tubercles and fish and coneys there, the flesh of these latter prolific rodents being highly recommended for his purpose, both broiled and stewed with a blade of mace and a pod or two of capsicum chillies.: 1.7698424133639536
After this homily which he delivered with much warmth of asseveration Mr Mulligan in a trice put off from his hat a kerchief with which he had shielded it.: 1.9765814592052062
They both, it seems, had been overtaken by the rain and for all their mending their pace had taken water, as might be observed by Mr Mulligan’s smallclothes of a hodden grey which was now somewhat piebald.: 2.488237040186181
His project meanwhile was very favourably entertained by his auditors and won hearty eulogies from all though Mr Dixon of Mary’s excepted to it, asking with a finicking air did he purpose also to carry coals to Newcastle.: 1.9617103820091777
Mr Mulligan however made court to the scholarly by an apt quotation from the classics which, as it dwelt upon his memory, seemed to him a sound and tasteful support of his contention: _Talis ac tanta depravatio hujus seculi, O quirites, ut matresfamiliarum nostrae lascivas cujuslibet semiviri libici titillationes testibus ponderosis atque excelsis erectionibus centurionum Romanorum magnopere anteponunt_, while for those of ruder wit he drove home his point by analogies of the animal kingdom more suitable to their stomach, the buck and doe of the forest glade, the farmyard drake and duck.: 2.7546602388418475
Valuing himself not a little upon his elegance, being indeed a proper man of person, this talkative now applied himself to his dress with animadversions of some heat upon the sudden whimsy of the atmospherics while the company lavished their encomiums upon the project he had advanced.: 2.0547557378418047
The young gentleman, his friend, overjoyed as he was at a passage that had late befallen him, could not forbear to tell it his nearest neighbour.: 2.103359526011587
Mr Mulligan, now perceiving the table, asked for whom were those loaves and fishes and, seeing the stranger, he made him a civil bow and said, Pray, sir, was you in need of any professional assistance we could give?: 1.8598845502033783
Who, upon his offer, thanked him very heartily, though preserving his proper distance, and replied that he was come there about a lady, now an inmate of Horne’s house, that was in an interesting condition, poor body, from woman’s woe (and here he fetched a deep sigh) to know if her happiness had yet taken place.: 1.927447150956469
Mr Dixon, to turn the table, took on to ask of Mr Mulligan himself whether his incipient ventripotence, upon which he rallied him, betokened an ovoblastic gestation in the prostatic utricle or male womb or was due, as with the noted physician, Mr Austin Meldon, to a wolf in the stomach.: 2.5775833394519183
For answer Mr Mulligan, in a gale of laughter at his smalls, smote himself bravely below the diaphragm, exclaiming with an admirable droll mimic of Mother Grogan (the most excellent creature of her sex though ’tis pity she’s a trollop): There’s a belly that never bore a bastard.: 2.3675492941986045
This was so happy a conceit that it renewed the storm of mirth and threw the whole room into the most violent agitations of delight.: 1.6961466359354116
The spry rattle had run on in the same vein of mimicry but for some larum in the antechamber.: 2.7208755352667353
Here the listener who was none other than the Scotch student, a little fume of a fellow, blond as tow, congratulated in the liveliest fashion with the young gentleman and, interrupting the narrative at a salient point, having desired his visavis with a polite beck to have the obligingness to pass him a flagon of cordial waters at the same time by a questioning poise of the head (a whole century of polite breeding had not achieved so nice a gesture) to which was united an equivalent but contrary balance of the bottle asked the narrator as plainly as was ever done in words if he might treat him with a cup of it.: 1.9491946202169361
_Mais bien sûr_, noble stranger, said he cheerily, _et mille compliments_.: 1.9591129117917898
That you may and very opportunely.: 1.6866267693038617
There wanted nothing but this cup to crown my felicity.: 1.4456970355642473
But, gracious heaven, was I left with but a crust in my wallet and a cupful of water from the well, my God, I would accept of them and find it in my heart to kneel down upon the ground and give thanks to the powers above for the happiness vouchsafed me by the Giver of good things.: 1.934128608752206
With these words he approached the goblet to his lips, took a complacent draught of the cordial, slicked his hair and, opening his bosom, out popped a locket that hung from a silk riband, that very picture which he had cherished ever since her hand had wrote therein.: 1.9094540112991043
Gazing upon those features with a world of tenderness, Ah, Monsieur, he said, had you but beheld her as I did with these eyes at that affecting instant with her dainty tucker and her new coquette cap (a gift for her feastday as she told me prettily) in such an artless disorder, of so melting a tenderness, ’pon my conscience, even you, Monsieur, had been impelled by generous nature to deliver yourself wholly into the hands of such an enemy or to quit the field for ever.: 1.7840926861400637
I declare, I was never so touched in all my life.: 2.0066883026789046
God, I thank thee, as the Author of my days!: 2.527282791210397
Thrice happy will he be whom so amiable a creature will bless with her favours.: 1.3648561563334352
A sigh of affection gave eloquence to these words and, having replaced the locket in his bosom, he wiped his eye and sighed again.: 1.7456746029145518
Beneficent Disseminator of blessings to all Thy creatures, how great and universal must be that sweetest of Thy tyrannies which can hold in thrall the free and the bond, the simple swain and the polished coxcomb, the lover in the heyday of reckless passion and the husband of maturer years.: 2.072774282032918
But indeed, sir, I wander from the point.: 2.2707094842408555
How mingled and imperfect are all our sublunary joys.: 1.3656134732446665
Maledicity!: 8.936658005791672
he exclaimed in anguish.: 1.619245657129003
Would to God that foresight had but remembered me to take my cloak along!: 1.6145965601207244
I could weep to think of it.: 2.2734375140227745
Then, though it had poured seven showers, we were neither of us a penny the worse.: 1.6083619501764512
But beshrew me, he cried, clapping hand to his forehead, tomorrow will be a new day and, thousand thunders, I know of a _marchand de capotes_, Monsieur Poyntz, from whom I can have for a _livre_ as snug a cloak of the French fashion as ever kept a lady from wetting.: 2.423919461994671

Every phase of the situation was successively eviscerated: the prenatal repugnance of uterine brothers, the Caesarean section, posthumity with respect to the father and, that rarer form, with respect to the mother, the fratricidal case known as the Childs Murder and rendered memorable by the impassioned plea of Mr Advocate Bushe which secured the acquittal of the wrongfully accused, the rights of primogeniture and king’s bounty touching twins and triplets, miscarriages and infanticides, simulated or dissimulated, the acardiac _foetus in foetu_ and aprosopia due to a congestion, the agnathia of certain chinless Chinamen (cited by Mr Candidate Mulligan) in consequence of defective reunion of the maxillary knobs along the medial line so that (as he said) one ear could hear what the other spoke, the benefits of anesthesia or twilight sleep, the prolongation of labour pains in advanced gravidancy by reason of pressure on the vein, the premature relentment of the amniotic fluid (as exemplified in the actual case) with consequent peril of sepsis to the matrix, artificial insemination by means of syringes, involution of the womb consequent upon the menopause, the problem of the perpetration of the species in the case of females impregnated by delinquent rape, that distressing manner of delivery called by the Brandenburghers _Sturzgeburt,_ the recorded instances of multiseminal, twikindled and monstrous births conceived during the catamenic period or of consanguineous parents—in a word all the cases of human nativity which Aristotle has classified in his masterpiece with chromolithographic illustrations.: 2.3612277111715962
The gravest problems of obstetrics and forensic medicine were examined with as much animation as the most popular beliefs on the state of pregnancy such as the forbidding to a gravid woman to step over a countrystile lest, by her movement, the navelcord should strangle her creature and the injunction upon her in the event of a yearning, ardently and ineffectually entertained, to place her hand against that part of her person which long usage has consecrated as the seat of castigation.: 1.9931318739420871

Even the allwisest Stagyrite was bitted, bridled and mounted by a light of love.: 1.788893096185307
LYNCH: Ba!: 1.2051825363409558
STEPHEN: Anyway, who wants two gestures to illustrate a loaf and a jug?: 1.4239457314654167
This movement illustrates the loaf and jug of bread or wine in Omar.: 1.6265978583986445
Hold my stick.: 1.2282152448568155
LYNCH: Damn your yellow stick.: 1.3961064771382263
Where are we going?: 3.5957131736045533
STEPHEN: Lecherous lynx, to _la belle dame sans merci,_ Georgina Johnson, _ad deam qui laetificat iuventutem meam._  _(Stephen thrusts the ashplant on him and slowly holds out his hands, his head going back till both hands are a span from his breast, down turned, in planes intersecting, the fingers about to part, the left being higher.)_  LYNCH: Which is the jug of bread?: 2.1819478279434197
It skills not.: 2.4143125286390847
That or the customhouse.: 1.62757106758285
Illustrate thou.: 1.7086750405564526

Shouldering the lamp he staggers away through the crowd with his flaring cresset._  _Snakes of river fog creep slowly.: 2.7539401065390563
From drains, clefts, cesspools, middens arise on all sides stagnant fumes.: 2.5477241698125415
A glow leaps in the south beyond the seaward reaches of the river.: 1.5532843297046566
The navvy, staggering forward, cleaves the crowd and lurches towards the tramsiding.: 2.2180321953872992
On the farther side under the railway bridge Bloom appears, flushed, panting, cramming bread and chocolate into a sidepocket.: 1.734206954488603
From Gillen’s hairdresser’s window a composite portrait shows him gallant Nelson’s image.: 2.2183369234486503
A concave mirror at the side presents to him lovelorn longlost lugubru Booloohoom.: 1.5497446605346983
Grave Gladstone sees him level, Bloom for Bloom.: 1.4567269727334962
He passes, struck by the stare of truculent Wellington, but in the convex mirror grin unstruck the bonham eyes and fatchuck cheekchops of Jollypoldy the rixdix doldy._  _At Antonio Rabaiotti’s door Bloom halts, sweated under the bright arclamp.: 2.2818812818349543
He disappears.: 2.007154825737265

N.: 2.2412697405510147
g.: 2.4285698487738796
Ah!: 4.213168971631986

Why did I run?: 2.5012321707248657

FIRST WATCH: What do you tax him with?: 3.1159163882689143
MARY DRISCOLL: He made a certain suggestion but I thought more of myself as poor as I am.: 1.884781833629709

Incautiously I took your part when you were accused of pilfering.: 1.7864172385076569
There’s a medium in all things.: 2.9697454210839194
Play cricket.: 1.583403391336072
MARY DRISCOLL: _(Excitedly.)_ As God is looking down on me this night if ever I laid a hand to them oylsters!: 2.13688470006619

Did something happen?: 1.2495290326786797

The accused will now make a bogus statement.: 1.4214710763865508
_(Bloom, pleading not guilty and holding a fullblown waterlily, begins a long unintelligible speech.: 2.563655003736098
They would hear what counsel had to say in his stirring address to the grand jury.: 1.7524518109934135
He was down and out but, though branded as a black sheep, if he might say so, he meant to reform, to retrieve the memory of the past in a purely sisterly way and return to nature as a purely domestic animal.: 1.8600708338372673
A sevenmonths’ child, he had been carefully brought up and nurtured by an aged bedridden parent.: 2.7662378879297855
An acclimatised Britisher, he had seen that summer eve from the footplate of an engine cab of the Loop line railway company while the rain refrained from falling glimpses, as it were, through the windows of loveful households in Dublin city and urban district of scenes truly rural of happiness of the better land with Dockrell’s wallpaper at one and ninepence a dozen, innocent Britishborn bairns lisping prayers to the Sacred Infant, youthful scholars grappling with their pensums or model young ladies playing on the pianoforte or anon all with fervour reciting the family rosary round the crackling Yulelog while in the boreens and green lanes the colleens with their swains strolled what times the strains of the organtoned melodeon Britannia metalbound with four acting stops and twelvefold bellows, a sacrifice, greatest bargain ever...._  _(Renewed laughter.: 2.0294917276231446

O’MOLLOY: _(In barrister’s grey wig and stuffgown, speaking with a voice of pained protest.)_ This is no place for indecent levity at the expense of an erring mortal disguised in liquor.: 2.256341738382916
We are not in a beargarden nor at an Oxford rag nor is this a travesty of justice.: 2.6326160669243936
My client is an infant, a poor foreign immigrant who started scratch as a stowaway and is now trying to turn an honest penny.: 1.8781319855132423
The trumped up misdemeanour was due to a momentary aberration of heredity, brought on by hallucination, such familiarities as the alleged guilty occurrence being quite permitted in my client’s native place, the land of the Pharaoh.: 2.1157219635711852
_Prima facie_, I put it to you that there was no attempt at carnally knowing.: 2.2772236414355187
Intimacy did not occur and the offence complained of by Driscoll, that her virtue was solicited, was not repeated.: 1.6754674454129947
I would deal in especial with atavism.: 2.7723994045437297
There have been cases of shipwreck and somnambulism in my client’s family.: 2.119369421447386
If the accused could speak he could a tale unfold—one of the strangest that have ever been narrated between the covers of a book.: 2.0620991227952903
He himself, my lord, is a physical wreck from cobbler’s weak chest.: 2.5363493785324067
His submission is that he is of Mongolian extraction and irresponsible for his actions.: 4.205866933991483
Not all there, in fact.: 2.3057980528340036

O’MOLLOY: _(Hotly to the populace.)_ This is a lonehand fight.: 3.5817576903010644

The Mosaic code has superseded the law of the jungle.: 1.9281521448319177

MRS BELLINGHAM: He addressed me in several handwritings with fulsome compliments as a Venus in furs and alleged profound pity for my frostbound coachman Palmer while in the same breath he expressed himself as envious of his earflaps and fleecy sheepskins and of his fortunate proximity to my person, when standing behind my chair wearing my livery and the armorial bearings of the Bellingham escutcheon garnished sable, a buck’s head couped or.: 2.2292182081209386

THE HONOURABLE MRS MERVYN TALBOYS: _(In amazon costume, hard hat, jackboots cockspurred, vermilion waistcoat, fawn musketeer gauntlets with braided drums, long train held up and hunting crop with which she strikes her welt constantly.)_ Also me.: 1.901532893326865

I have it still.: 3.456334622218587

Dignam’s voice, muffled, is heard baying under ground:_ Dignam’s dead and gone below.: 2.330881047414255
_Tom Rochford, robinredbreasted, in cap and breeches, jumps from his twocolumned machine.)_  TOM ROCHFORD: _(A hand to his breastbone, bows.)_ Reuben J.: 2.600638954608265
A florin I find him.: 1.2696674063100382
_(He fixes the manhole with a resolute stare.)_ My turn now on.: 2.5857539585098896
Follow me up to Carlow.: 1.5630650428420707
_(He executes a daredevil salmon leap in the air and is engulfed in the coalhole.: 2.8051331376957935
Two discs on the columns wobble, eyes of nought.: 2.039725155368261
Bloom plodges forward again through the sump.: 1.3795148346853379
Kisses chirp amid the rifts of fog.: 3.08237755582624
A piano sounds.: 1.2050544783127721
He stands before a lighted house, listening.: 1.5554439725892055
The kisses, winging from their bowers, fly about him, twittering, warbling, cooing.)_  THE KISSES: _(Warbling.)_ Leo!: 2.1835720951411397
_(Twittering.)_ Icky licky micky sticky for Leo!: 1.9816525993468403
_(Cooing.)_ Coo coocoo!: 3.0113826126332444

_(They rustle, flutter upon his garments, alight, bright giddy flecks, silvery sequins.)_  BLOOM: A man’s touch.: 2.239564961244763
Sad music.: 1.6044408582357998
Church music.: 1.6044408582357998
Perhaps here.: 1.5441878669688203
_(Zoe Higgins, a young whore in a sapphire slip, closed with three bronze buckles, a slim black velvet fillet round her throat, nods, trips down the steps and accosts him.)_  ZOE: Are you looking for someone?: 1.984102678433003
He’s inside with his friend.: 2.9493261839409093
BLOOM: Is this Mrs Mack’s?: 1.4458998659980415
ZOE: No, eightyone.: 2.9809268150615917
Mrs Cohen’s.: 1.5621517034606096
You might go farther and fare worse.: 1.3427052213197541
Mother Slipperslapper.: 5.721231130007474
_(Familiarly.)_ She’s on the job herself tonight with the vet her tipster that gives her all the winners and pays for her son in Oxford.: 2.276831955148651
Working overtime but her luck’s turned today.: 1.4495612785749472
_(Suspiciously.)_ You’re not his father, are you?: 3.6097114475999503
BLOOM: Not I!: 2.305323760547553
ZOE: You both in black.: 1.8822834156858252
Has little mousey any tickles tonight?: 1.4824784864418707
_(His skin, alert, feels her fingertips approach.: 1.825678882052519
A hand glides over his left thigh.)_  ZOE: How’s the nuts?: 2.2977862997025222
BLOOM: Off side.: 1.2595305835780244
Heavier, I suppose.: 2.245758194595078
One in a million my tailor, Mesias, says.: 1.7098794763092584
ZOE: _(In sudden alarm.)_ You’ve a hard chancre.: 3.361204337998854
BLOOM: Not likely.: 2.00828603723916
ZOE: I feel it.: 2.439796063071684
_(Her hand slides into his left trouser pocket and brings out a hard black shrivelled potato.: 1.7086002441182457
Heirloom.: 5.467216183749365
ZOE: For Zoe?: 1.6330002862648454
For keeps?: 1.630956249944502
For being so nice, eh?: 1.4027500141782414
_(She puts the potato greedily into a pocket then links his arm, cuddling him with supple warmth.: 1.958648758758674
He smiles uneasily.: 1.589672358808715
Slowly, note by note, oriental music is played.: 1.3186256826578269
His smile softens.)_  ZOE: You’ll know me the next time.: 2.2270143695399405
BLOOM: _(Forlornly.)_ I never loved a dear gazelle but it was sure to...: 2.519020687419278
_(Gazelles are leaping, feeding on the mountains.: 2.3203666087928685
Near are lakes.: 1.2165072715588032
Round their shores file shadows black of cedargroves.: 1.3134857995135998
Aroma rises, a strong hairgrowth of resin.: 1.774821819368151
It burns, the orient, a sky of sapphire, cleft by the bronze flight of eagles.: 1.4343422027212451
Under it lies the womancity, nude, white, still, cool, in luxury.: 1.9725318030748118
A fountain murmurs among damask roses.: 1.2340187509807874
Mammoth roses murmur of scarlet winegrapes.: 1.4547250637725793
A wine of shame, lust, blood exudes, strangely murmuring.)_  ZOE: _(Murmuring singsong with the music, her odalisk lips lusciously smeared with salve of swinefat and rosewater.) Schorach ani wenowach, benoith Hierushaloim._  BLOOM: _(Fascinated.)_ I thought you were of good stock by your accent.: 2.7724904620967274
ZOE: And you know what thought did?: 2.7585265590946104
_(She bites his ear gently with little goldstopped teeth, sending on him a cloying breath of stale garlic.: 2.059681613149236
The roses draw apart, disclose a sepulchre of the gold of kings and their mouldering bones.)_  BLOOM: _(Draws back, mechanically caressing her right bub with a flat awkward hand.)_ Are you a Dublin girl?: 1.8958474875358913
ZOE: _(Catches a stray hair deftly and twists it to her coil.)_ No bloody fear.: 2.1878863464974403
I’m English.: 7.701950382790077
Have you a swaggerroot?: 3.8564208723049305
BLOOM: _(As before.)_ Rarely smoke, dear.: 2.0529779701892754
Cigar now and then.: 2.356718494987505
Childish device.: 1.4153259930437092
_(Lewdly.)_ The mouth can be better engaged than with a cylinder of rank weed.: 1.6980788923726569
ZOE: Go on.: 2.160602502429943
Make a stump speech out of it.: 1.6661860240284485
BLOOM: _(In workman’s corduroy overalls, black gansy with red floating tie and apache cap.)_ Mankind is incorrigible.: 2.589868691275251
Sir Walter Ralegh brought from the new world that potato and that weed, the one a killer of pestilence by absorption, the other a poisoner of the ear, eye, heart, memory, will, understanding, all.: 2.3536654482942705
That is to say he brought the poison a hundred years before another person whose name I forget brought the food.: 1.7704539111965956
Suicide.: 3.0324287377854287
Lies.: 3.9368358781533885
All our habits.: 1.2258274465740135
Why, look at our public life!: 2.13764499092432

Lord mayor of Dublin!: 3.0297290643203305
BLOOM: _(In alderman’s gown and chain.)_ Electors of Arran Quay, Inns Quay, Rotunda, Mountjoy and North Dock, better run a tramline, I say, from the cattlemarket to the river.: 2.0698346234509994
That’s the music of the future.: 4.135703302124062
That’s my programme.: 7.958565091708567

_(Several wellknown burgesses, city magnates and freemen of the city shake hands with Bloom and congratulate him.: 2.2077459368840473

_They nod vigorously in agreement.)_  LATE LORD MAYOR HARRINGTON: _(In scarlet robe with mace, gold mayoral chain and large white silk scarf.)_ That alderman sir Leo Bloom’s speech be printed at the expense of the ratepayers.: 1.7824337831536994

COUNCILLOR LORCAN SHERLOCK: Carried unanimously.: 1.4752196573964196
Machines is their cry, their chimera, their panacea.: 3.0770820788286377

The poor man starves while they are grassing their royal mountain stags or shooting peasants and phartridges in their purblind pomp of pelf and power.: 1.9703810214789448
But their reign is rover for rever and ever and ev...: 1.5995808798343691
_(Prolonged applause.: 1.2031918202759317

DR MULLIGAN: _(In motor jerkin, green motorgoggles on his brow.)_ Dr Bloom is bisexually abnormal.: 2.4966979225089694
He has recently escaped from Dr Eustace’s private asylum for demented gentlemen.: 1.398846412317261
Born out of bedlock hereditary epilepsy is present, the consequence of unbridled lust.: 2.012837799646445
Traces of elephantiasis have been discovered among his ascendants.: 1.678248417423431
There are marked symptoms of chronic exhibitionism.: 1.2607585106016328
Ambidexterity is also latent.: 1.8140722714498831
He is prematurely bald from selfabuse, perversely idealistic in consequence, a reformed rake, and has metal teeth.: 2.5742303606334755
In consequence of a family complex he has temporarily lost his memory and I believe him to be more sinned against than sinning.: 1.9336541978297002
I have made a pervaginal examination and, after application of the acid test to 5427 anal, axillary, pectoral and pubic hairs, I declare him to be _virgo intacta._  _(Bloom holds his high grade hat over his genital organs.)_  DR MADDEN: Hypsospadia is also marked.: 2.354177297886122
In the interest of coming generations I suggest that the parts affected should be preserved in spirits of wine in the national teratological museum.: 1.597893048425693

It is albuminoid.: 3.014223395503428
Salivation is insufficient, the patellar reflex intermittent.: 5.803857029516153
DR PUNCH COSTELLO: The _fetor judaicus_ is most perceptible.: 3.229328858840547
DR DIXON: _(Reads a bill of health.)_ Professor Bloom is a finished example of the new womanly man.: 1.9954808683054548
His moral nature is simple and lovable.: 1.3416595905204154
Many have found him a dear man, a dear person.: 1.8541915669382696
He is a rather quaint fellow on the whole, coy though not feebleminded in the medical sense.: 2.3172432281456063
He has written a really beautiful letter, a poem in itself, to the court missionary of the Reformed Priests’ Protection Society which clears up everything.: 1.72167310433409
He is practically a total abstainer and I can affirm that he sleeps on a straw litter and eats the most Spartan food, cold dried grocer’s peas.: 1.7072284570920044
He wears a hairshirt of pure Irish manufacture winter and summer and scourges himself every Saturday.: 2.2403134753010683
He was, I understand, at one time a firstclass misdemeanant in Glencree reformatory.: 2.226019819318468
Another report states that he was a very posthumous child.: 3.236925366020625

It may be an old hymn to Demeter or also illustrate _Cœla enarrant gloriam Domini._ It is susceptible of nodes or modes as far apart as hyperphrygian and mixolydian and of texts so divergent as priests haihooping round David’s that is Circe’s or what am I saying Ceres’ altar and David’s tip from the stable to his chief bassoonist about the alrightness of his almightiness.: 2.473928175766221

If you give me a hand a second, sergeant...: 1.8450889636135253
FIRST WATCH: Name and address.: 3.444459397886146
_(Corny Kelleher, weepers round his hat, a death wreath in his hand, appears among the bystanders.)_  BLOOM: _(Quickly.)_ O, the very man!: 2.4205287566044085
A bit sprung.: 1.0919706831482798
Get those policemen to move those loafers back.: 1.3600972114318879
SECOND WATCH: Night, Mr Kelleher.: 3.08617675901384
CORNY KELLEHER: _(To the watch, with drawling eye.)_ That’s all right.: 2.937823245562868
I know him.: 2.0043464471546417
Won a bit on the races.: 1.9152632020189735
Gold cup.: 3.6388656181939303
Throwaway.: 4.734169496692892
Do you follow me?: 1.1087802995161817
FIRST WATCH: _(Turns to the crowd.)_ Here, what are you all gaping at?: 2.9131177748917714
Move on out of that.: 3.0362903205456235

That’ll be all right.: 2.4990197927470694
_(He laughs, shaking his head.)_ We were often as bad ourselves, ay or worse.: 2.40981053837368
Eh, what?: 1.7899139266581567
FIRST WATCH: _(Laughs.)_ I suppose so.: 3.862998992448437
CORNY KELLEHER: _(Nudges the second watch.)_ Come and wipe your name off the slate.: 2.65807339583335
_(He lilts, wagging his head.)_ With my tooraloom tooraloom tooraloom tooraloom.: 2.9034315255610674
What, eh, do you follow me?: 1.844950445928696
SECOND WATCH: _(Genially.)_ Ah, sure we were too.: 2.684226540095654
CORNY KELLEHER: _(Winking.)_ Boys will be boys.: 2.3896051665012727
I’ve a car round there.: 2.3834882455483917
SECOND WATCH: All right, Mr Kelleher.: 3.2787442287825894
Good night.: 2.7170840256142452
BLOOM: _(Shakes hands with both of the watch in turn.)_ Thank you very much, gentlemen.: 2.1445167349398195
_(He mumbles confidentially.)_ We don’t want any scandal, you understand.: 2.7932279305445085
Father is a wellknown highly respected citizen.: 1.6972034927581892
Just a little wild oats, you understand.: 2.100507902358837
FIRST WATCH: O.: 5.561816087166007
I understand, sir.: 2.7992368740035563
SECOND WATCH: That’s all right, sir.: 3.9240295449687563
FIRST WATCH: It was only in case of corporal injuries I’d have to report it at the station.: 2.7721668336984675

Quite right.: 3.01249976024807
Only your bounden duty.: 1.5093816217474163
SECOND WATCH: It’s our duty.: 4.711175715407836
CORNY KELLEHER: Good night, men.: 2.67233954000533
THE WATCH: _(Saluting together.)_ Night, gentlemen.: 2.6098507244291826
_(They move off with slow heavy tread.)_  BLOOM: _(Blows.)_ Providential you came on the scene.: 2.0035626940853124
You have a car?...: 3.2809048217644032
CORNY KELLEHER: _(Laughs, pointing his thumb over his right shoulder to the car brought up against the scaffolding.)_ Two commercials that were standing fizz in Jammet’s.: 1.9668311556063018
Like princes, faith.: 1.4230903580022065
One of them lost two quid on the race.: 1.952443687717334
And were on for a go with the jolly girls.: 1.985509002458249
So I landed them up on Behan’s car and down to nighttown.: 1.603526283723841
BLOOM: I was just going home by Gardiner street when I happened to...: 2.3035123603155285
CORNY KELLEHER: _(Laughs.)_ Sure they wanted me to join in with the mots.: 2.2114006045561854
No, by God, says I.: 2.652734583033704
Not for old stagers like myself and yourself.: 1.79007191088835
_(He laughs again and leers with lacklustre eye.)_ Thanks be to God we have it in the house, what, eh, do you follow me?: 3.134362925103013
Hah, hah, hah!: 1.7820142480689038
BLOOM: _(Tries to laugh.)_ He, he, he!: 3.7912872587919333
Matter of fact I was just visiting an old friend of mine there, Virag, you don’t know him (poor fellow, he’s laid up for the past week) and we had a liquor together and I was just making my way home...: 2.2984210984788955
_(The horse neighs.)_  THE HORSE: Hohohohohohoh!: 3.211739600960059
Hohohohome!: 8.936658005791672
CORNY KELLEHER: Sure it was Behan our jarvey there that told me after we left the two commercials in Mrs Cohen’s and I told him to pull up and got off to see.: 2.116334932860576
_(He laughs.)_ Sober hearsedrivers a speciality.: 3.518579017766267
Will I give him a lift home?: 2.1500386583411135
Where does he hang out?: 1.7381615662330137
Somewhere in Cabra, what?: 1.464502370697766
BLOOM: No, in Sandycove, I believe, from what he let drop.: 2.2358353947146394
_(Stephen, prone, breathes to the stars.: 1.7917061927391704
Corny Kelleher, asquint, drawls at the horse.: 3.0417170958724933
Bloom, in gloom, looms down.)_  CORNY KELLEHER: _(Scratches his nape.)_ Sandycove!: 1.7816778676440357
_(He bends down and calls to Stephen.)_ Eh!: 2.9313600602622434
_(He calls again.)_ Eh!: 3.8097972336623798
He’s covered with shavings anyhow.: 2.8558317699280993
Take care they didn’t lift anything off him.: 2.0357114627339254
BLOOM: No, no, no.: 3.5842193880096755
I have his money and his hat here and stick.: 1.6696976163274095
CORNY KELLEHER: Ah, well, he’ll get over it.: 3.6422902378864013
No bones broken.: 1.239632098587023
Well, I’ll shove along.: 4.438743900838254
_(He laughs.)_ I’ve a rendezvous in the morning.: 5.00438582474067
Burying the dead.: 1.6253644865182617
Safe home!: 3.1314486057583655

I’ll just wait and take him along in a few...: 2.408724566729359
_(Corny Kelleher returns to the outside car and mounts it.: 1.5248927822305862
